Reviews.Title: “Hostel like experience at twice the price”
Reviews.Author: kayaker94403
Reviews.Content: The fact that my company put me at a 1-star hotel for a tradeshow is a rant for another time and location but if you are looking for no frills basic hotel experience you're better off going to a hostel and paying half the price. The rooms are basically a cot bed a dresser with 4 hangers and a light switch. You get a private bathroom which emits a sewer like smell that will require you to keep the bathroom door closed at all times. The walls are paper thin so you get what I like to call a 360 degree conversational / experience from your close neighbors with a couple having sex at 3am as a side bonus. I appreciated that after being on an international flight for 17 hours without sleep. Bring not only your own shampoo but also soap as the hotel provdes none. There is one iron that is shared among the 40+ rooms but I have yet to get my fair share out of it. Maybe if I come back a week from Wednesday I'll get my turn. Until then I'm walking around in wrinkled shirts. They have WiFi but it's only in the lobby and they provide a hard bench to sit on. Finally bring lots of cash as the hotel does not accept credit cards. I will say that the hotel staff does seem friendly and overall cleanliness is acceptable. Yes it's close to the Rambla but so are alot of other hotels that are much nicer for probably 20 more Euros a night. For college students and just people traveling on minimal budget...hit up a hostel and get a private bed with shared bathroom. For business travellers if your company puts you up here you have to question whether your boss really likes you and might want to spruce up the old resume. I am

Reviews.Title: “Good value in El Raval”
Reviews.Author: JulesSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Peninsular several times over the past 6 yrs, and always find it a good value (breakfast is included in the rates). It's a no-frills hotel located not far from Las Ramblas in barrio El Raval (c/ Sant Pau) with a professional, welcoming staff and comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: germanfan
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical staying at this hotel due to the many poor reviews. However, we were traveling as a group and the group leader chose this hotel. In summary, my experiences were similar to the others writing positive reviews. The rooms are basic, clean and I was able to sleep quite comfortably in a room on the second floor. Not sure if I would stay here with my wife in the future (we are a bit more spoiled), but for a group of men or students, it fits the bill quite nicely. I would recommend it for people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel but great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: CarolineMcCabe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights on an architectural study trip. I have stayed in 5 star hotels in many cities around the world, so this was my first experience of a 1 star. I can honestly say I was a bit worried when I read the reviews on here, but then you can't please everybody. I found it great value for money. We had a room for 4 on the 4th floor. It was a large room, basic, but clean and comfortable. The beds were made every day and clean towels in the room. The staff were friendly and the continental breakfast was what you would expect from a 1 star. The hotel is centrally located, close to La Rambla and walking distance from main attractions and metro. Lovely interior courtyard for relaxing after sightseeing. A bit noisy at night, but this is what you get if you stay in centre of town. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Bridget M
Reviews.Content: Our room was really clean, a good size and very quiet. Beds(very comfortable) were changed every second day and towels replaced even when not requested. Plenty to eat at breakfast. Location is excellent, just a short distance from La Rambla. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Fantastic value at £30 per night. There was a real cross section of ages and nationalities visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Dire Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pocketsireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night,and probably the worst hotel we ever stayed in.Room was very small with very basic facilities,no air con and a noisy fan,the heat was unbearable.This hotel is not up to the standard of even a hostel.The area does not feel safe as there are a lot of shady looking people loitering around the street.

Reviews.Title: “The worse place ever - a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Dan A
Reviews.Content: We came as a family to this hotel after booking 3 nights through their website. I can describe this hotel using one word : Nightmare. Although it is located close to the center (The Rambla street), it is actually placed in a side alley where unpleasant people (to say the least) wander during evening and night hours. The hotel itself is literally dirty. The worse thing is that in all the beds there were bedbugs crawling on the beds and the walls; did I already say a nightmare? In the middle of the second night, when we realized that the crawling creatures are not just naive beetles, we packed our staff and moved downstairs to book a different hotel using the "lobby" computer. The reception clerk was really angry and nervous, cursing in Spanish. He smelled like he drunk an entire bar and was quite aggressive. Anyway, we moved at sunrise to the next hotel. I CLEARLY RECOMMEND NOT TO GO TO THIS HOTEL in Saint Pau 34 street, Barcelona!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful customer service”
Reviews.Author: Jubelle
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel, location is okay as it's close to lots of decent shops and bars although it's also very close to some dodgy areas. The staff in the hotel were dreadful!! The man who greeted us wasn't helpful or friendly. The member of staff on nightshift on the Saturday night was horrific! I asked for help to open my bedroom door and because I had come back late he was angry and became quite aggressive as he clearly did not want to have any hassle from customers. He swore at me and told me to shut up several times when I tried to point out that it's his job to help paying customers at the hotel. Would never stay there again and would advise anyone else going to Barcelona to choose a better place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “We hated it, we will definitely not be back!”
Reviews.Author: sophiee_ox
Reviews.Content: Truly appalling, stayed here for 4 nights in July the room stunk of sewage stunk the room out, the maid would leave the window open every time we went out which made the smell worse for when we returned. The bathroom doors didn't shut, only one plug socket worked which was in the bathroom, there wasn't a shower curtain so it was very dangerous having the plug socket there which added to the inconvenience. There were hand prints on our wall, the only one positive would be the air conditioning which did work but others from our group had rooms which the air conditioning didn't work, a friend found a heroine syringe in the draw, nice to see the room had been cleaned. The breakfast was basic, 2 rock solid rolls and some pretty disgusting looking processed ham and cheese. So really really really wouldn't recommend staying here, the hostels opposite looked much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, noisy, stinky! Horrible.”
Reviews.Author: Popcornisgood61
Reviews.Content: The worst "hotel" (can you even call it that?) I have EVER stayed in! My family and I only stayed one night. At a cost of about $120 US, I wasn't expecting plush, in fact I expected spartan, but at least clean. Our room was on the third floor, above the front entrance, with a balcony overlooking the street. The bedsheets were clean, but that's about it. The floor hadn't even been swept, let alone mopped. The bathroom appeared clean, but it smelled awful, as though the urine residue from previous guests still lingered. I had to try to hold my breath everytime I used it. There was a sewer smell emanating from the street or from somewhere. We tried to sleep but there were rowdy drunks who were shouting at each other and cackling hysterically at the bar below. Then there were the periodic rattletrap trucks with no mufflers driving by, followed by intermittent homeless folks who decided it would be fun to play kick the can at 2 in the morning. I was never so happy to leave a place.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hostal in great location”
Reviews.Author: Amberji
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights. Our room was small and quiet -- perfectly adequate. The hostal is in a great location, just off Las Ramblas and within walking distance of several landmarks as well as restaurant areas, Metro stops, and bus stops. Free WiFi, but only works in the reception area; free breakfast is fairly extensive for a hostal (cereal; rolls, ham, and cheese; juice, tea, coffee); luggage can be left for the day before checking in or after checking out.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, come with few expectations and you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: KimWS
Reviews.Content: First night, as we were the last to arrive in the hotel for the night, we were given room 316 - 3 single beds, a wardrobe and an horrendous smell, coming from the sewers 4 storeys below, we think! The hotel was full that night, but the nice older man at reception assured us we would be shifted in the morning. One of us slept well - I think it might have been the gas!! We were able to move in the morning to a much larger room overlooking the little street above the entrance. This was, however, quite a noisy street, even though it is small. Breakfast is ok, nothing special. This is a cheapish hotel and unfortunately very noisy in some parts. The first room we had was reasonably quiet although as the floors are all tiled, there are echos all around the place and the walls are not very thick! The courtyard is lovely but little used and closed after 9pm. Beds are hard and pillows and towels very thin! Bathrooms are clean. Location is excellent. just along from La Rambla and very close to the food market - Mercat de la Boqueria. Placa de Catalunya is a 5-10 minute walk away. You get what you pay for - come with few expectations and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “School group or backpackers dream - romantic couples nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: bjc1980
Reviews.Content: Recently visited with large group, staff were very friendly and helpful. Safe provided which was great. It's a very Open building and everything echoes, at night this means even the smallest group coming back will wake you up. Rooms were very well looked after by cleaners, but very old and dated. No shower curtain meant that your bathroom was a wet room. Do not use this hotel if you want a romantic break, if you have a younger school group beware that other groups tend to come home after a few beers. If you are of college age it's ideal!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic--just as I remembered it!”
Reviews.Author: Gabysab
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay in Barcelona. I had booked a twin room for a friend and I back in the spring. I stayed at Hotel Peninsular in 2001 when I was in Spain and remembered that it was excellently located just off mid Las Ramblas. I had an opportunity to be in Barcelona overnight in July and took the time to visit Hotel Peninsular just to make sure it was as I remembered it. Jose was so accommodating to let me look around the hotel and peek in a room to make sure it would be up to par for my friend and our visit. The hotel was just as I remembered it! Clean, well-located, typically European. So, we returned in October and stayed there. I cannot say enough about how friendly and helpful Luis and Jose and the other employees at Hotel Peninsular were. The hotel price included continental breakfast every morning which we enjoyed. It was great to have multiple large cups of coffee to start our day to go with the croissants, bread, jam, juice and cereal. The hotel also had free Wi-Fi and a beautiful indoor courtyard where we could use our computer. We actually had a room on the first floor and the Wi-Fi worked in our room. The hotel was about a block off mid-Las Ramblas so the environment and ambiance was fantastic. I can't say enough good things about the hotel and will definitely be staying there again on my next trip to Barcelona. Thanks, Luis and Jose!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, quiet, close to the Rambla.”
Reviews.Author: EerwahVale
Reviews.Content: Room is basic, clean, double bed (bit squishy), but big new bathroom made up for compact bedroom. Breakfast basic but sufficient. The hotel is an easy walk to the Rambla but far enough to be quiet - no traffic in this street. Loved the ambience of the hotel with its historical qualities.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here is you are over 25 !”
Reviews.Author: Angie_and_co
Reviews.Content: Room ok. It is what it is .. which is a young peoples backpacking place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, bright, great price and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Louise_likes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peninsular between the 15th and 21st June. It was our 4th visit to Barcelona and I'm gutted I didn't discover the Peninsular sooner. It's in a fantastic location, half way up Las Ramblas, which is a brilliant base for sightseeing and shops. We were allocated an attic room and were really impressed, it was bright and clean with a small balcony and a lovely view up to the hills. Despite being in the attic above the 4th floor, the shower was great, probably the best hotel shower we've had for ages. Breakfast was exactly what you need to set you up for a day exploring the city - cereal, two fresh bread rolls (usually different breads each day), ham, cheese, jam, a little cake, juice, water, tea (which was really quite tasty), and contrary to other reports, good coffee! I really can't fault the Peninsular on value for money. Yes, the rooms are basic, but as far as I am concerned, it is a budget hotel that as made all the right decisions on what to compromise on. It is well run, with incredibly friendly, smart and efficient staff and it will be a pleasure to stay there again. Definitely the smart choice for a stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “My Worst Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: 825Becki
Reviews.Content: came to this hotel on June 29th - 2nd July and I've never seen anything like this before, got in my room and there were some ants running all over the walls and all you could smell was the sewers, the air conditioning didn't work proper and if we tried to open the window, which was nearly impossible you got face to face with dead birds on tin roofs. on my last night the toilet would not flush and the walls were moving with ants. it was horrible, we had to use the bath room on the landing. it also says a buffet for breakfast, I wouldn't really call 2 buns and little stale cake a buffet breakfast also the drinks with the buffet breakfast were orange juice like syrup and coffee like tar, not very appetising. not even worth one star this hotel, place to ovoid unless you want to share with creatures.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, great location and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Amandalovestravel
Reviews.Content: The location and price are phenomenal....walking distance to almost everything! The staff were very helpful and friendly...I had wanted a different room then originally given and they went out of their way to provide me with a room I would be happy with. Noise travels throughout the hotel but there are quieter rooms. The rooms are simple, very clean and range in sizes. All have their own bathroom and air conditioner. The beds are very firm and I found that using an extra comforter on the mattress made it much more comfortable. Love love love the courtyard and it's really what makes this hotel a gem to stay in. Very sunny and open. Breakfast was a couple of buns, cheese, meat...when in need for something more substantial, it was a quick walk to the market where I bought fresh fruit and pastries at very good prices. Location + Price + Awesome staff + clean rooms = A great place for your stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, it's clean and you get exactly what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: MikeTheSpur
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very basic but clean. We travelled with two other couples and their rooms were exactly like ours, basic but clean. Our room unlike the others suffered from the odd whiff but that was just our bad luck as nobody else's did. The staff were very friendly and helpful and suggested reasonably priced bars and resturants that were exactly as described. You can't fault the location it's perfect, acouple of minutes walk and you are mid point in La Rambla . If you want five star and want to pay for the privelage then stay at another hotel. If you want quaint but clean with good service stay here. Can't fault it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “It's a noisy Charming hostel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PlumsteadBilly
Reviews.Content: Pretty courtyard setting with rooms that are v.basic, no windows or charm. The softest wisper is magnified throughout the courtyard so expect to be disturbed at 7am when the maids prepare their assult on the rooms. We had 3 school groups of excited teens when we stayed and the noise was unbearable. We were so glad that the room became our base as Barca had too much to keep us locked up. Breakfast was simply two rolls, slices of ham, cheese, with coffee/ tea/ juice cereal & a small cake. Suited me fine! Overall an excellent location to explore. Near to the subway (Liecu, 3 min walk) and almost next door to a small shop to buy water etc..

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic with a great location”
Reviews.Author: GRM59
Reviews.Content: The Peninsular is a great budget choice. The rooms are basic and our shower provided hot water. The staff is extremely friendly, helpful, and speak English. They secured tickets for us to the Tablao Flamenco Cordobes, only a short stroll away on the LaRambla. Being so close to the LaRambla is a real bonus, we walked the length of it several times. The breakfast is simple, but adequate. The hotel is also within walking distance to the pier in one direction; and to the location of the double-decker sight-seeing bus in the other direction; and close to the metro. The staff also called a taxi to pick us up right at the door. Not sure our teenage grandkids would have enjoyed it there, but we did. If you want luxury, go someplace else; if you enjoy an adventure, stay at the Peninsular.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: diamondsgirl45
Reviews.Content: Extremely central hotel just minutes from the Ramblas.... clean, tidy rooms... not first class but perfectly acceptable. Breakfast was sufficient, and the amazing courtyard was stunning. Reception staff were very helpful and there was a safety deposit box to leave valuables, which we took advantage of. A computer in the lobby helped as well to keep in touch, and we were able to leave our suitcases so we could have the last day sightseeing, without dragging them with us. There were a couple of school parties when we were there which made it a bit noisy late evening but only for a short time. I would completely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Caldaro sulla Strada del Vino, Italy
Reviews.Title: “For Schooltravels”
Reviews.Author: MarkusDisse
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is perfect for large Groups of young people... Its located a few meters from the "Las Ramblas" which is the main street of Barcelona. Also the price is not exagerated

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and inexpensive hotel - don't believe all the bad things on here”
Reviews.Author: RyChrisLA
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Barcelona and stayed at the Hotel Peninsular - was a little nervous going into the trip because of some of the bad reviews on this site...but I have to say the hotel was excellent overall. The staff was very courteous and helpful, the location was ideal right off the main tourist area of La Rambla - and the hotel appearance was very nice, especially considering how cheap the rooms are for the area (we paid 78 Euros for Room 409 with two single beds). I will agree that the rooms have very thin walls (we heard people talking next door but they were also playing their music pretty loud too) - and I can imagine during a very crowded times the hotel could be noisy due to the echo from the main courtyard area - but we requested a room in the back and top floor of the hotel (outside of the main courtyard rooms). The rooms were very basic - two single beds, bed tables and armoire; bathroom was very clean and shower had great water pressure - we got two towels and soap included; they had maid service every day as well. So I would recommend this place for anyone looking to find a cheap hotel in the heart of Barcelona (definitely a step up from other hostels in the area)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel better than expected, despite poor reviews, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: maccamacaulay
Reviews.Content: Read reviews prior to travel and we were apprehensive. However, upon our arrival, the hotel was clean and the staff both friendly and professional. The location of the hotel was perfect for site seeing, transport(Metro). We would certainly use the same hotel and enjoyed our Barcelona experience totally.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: eurotravellady
Reviews.Content: Basic but great! Beautiful building, great location, very friendly staff. We were very happy with our stay, the people at the front desk where very friendly and helpful. Overall great value and I would definelty stay here again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ericagreen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel quit a bit, but this is one hotel I will not return to. The showers went from scalding hot to ice cold no matter what time of day. Neither of us had a comfortable water temperature for showering during the 4 days we were there. The street is very shady, in fact someone attempted to pickpocket my husband just steps from the hotel one evening. There is a hostel nearby so expect loud, drunk college kids at all hours of the night. In fact the hotel was rather loud despite signs asking for "quiet hours." The beds and linens are old and uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a litte xtra $ to stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: wanderer_not_lost
Reviews.Content: I am a person that likes heat but this place was too much even for me. The air conditioning did not work and the street was too noisy and smelly to open the window, even though we were on the top floor. I complained but got no where. I read a review on tripadvisor that warned me about the lack of air conditioning (units do not work even though they tell you they are fine). I wish I had listened to trip advisor rather than Rick Steves.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: PRAust
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little hesitant about staying here. But the hotel is fine. The staff are friendly, the rooms are clean but basic. Breakfast is ok, not great, but fine and the rolls are not stale. Everything you need and a very good location. As to the smell referred to in one of the reviews, I got a whiff of this smell in various places in the old part of Barcelona. I imagine it's to be expected in old cities. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Ripleysfinest
Reviews.Content: We chose the peninsular hotel because of the location and price.... A girls weekend to celebrate a special birthday, we arrived late on Saturday night, and Jose Antonio was very welcoming. We had an insight into the seedy streets of Barcelona on the way to the hotel as the main access roads were closed due to the big festival ! A real eye opener and we would definitely not recommend exploring the area to theright of the hotel !!!! The rooms were big 5 beds in each, basic but clean, hot showers, clean towels, crisp fresh sheets and the floors were swept and tidy too. There are no luxuries, but thats not to be expected as the price reflects this! We cant comment on breakfast, as we slept in due to late nights!!, but there are an abundance of places to grab breakfast close by. The hotel was full, but not noisy at all! a mixture of ages were staying and it felt sequre as the doors are locked but manned 24 hours. Give the hotel a go.... Enjoy the city, have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: sfgirl48
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, just off Las Ramblas and near metro stops, shopping, bars and restaurants. Breakfast that is provided consists of two stale rolls, a stale muffin, juice and coffee. After changing rooms twice, I noticed that the rooms have a very bad funky smell, like the sewer is backed up or something. I actually went out and bought some air freshener to try and mitigate the smell to little avail. This hotel is VERY popular with the younger crowd so if you’re looking for someplace quiet, this is not it. The beds have seen better days and I could actually feel the springs through the mattresses. The air conditioning and electricity goes off and on starting around 3pm and WIFI access is only available on a random basis in the common areas on the first floor. The beds are made each day, air con turned off, windows left closed. The rooms are not cleaned daily and I had to ask for fresh towels more than once. The staff is somewhat rude, not helpful with directions, metro info or anything else. Basically, it is overpriced for what you get and not some place I would recommend unless you’re desperate to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - never stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: spainadvisor
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel at all. The room was disgusting, the lights did not work in the corridor so it was in complete darkness when trying to check in at night time, the window would not close let alone lock, the airconditioner did not work and the phone did not work. The staff member could not care less, and in fact told me to leave. This was at 2am, and I found another hotel, but this staff member was actually physically aggressive, standing in the doorway, shouting at me, and breaking my luggage trying to force me to stay after telling me to go. Then after all that they charged me! I have stayed in many hostels before, if I can give you any travel advice at all, it would be to NEVER stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay with 22 2nd Yr Business students!”
Reviews.Author: Crewe_CheshireFlo
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked though an educational travel agency. After reading some reviews we were a little nervous. This was totally unfounded! Hotel staff were very patient, especially considering our party consisted of 22 all over 18 students! Rooms were clean and quite charming. Located right in the heart of things with good access to public transport, the beach, shops, resturaunts etc. Great city, but do be aware of pickpockets - do not use rucksacks strapped to backs. Our party thoroughly enjoyed the 4 day residential and I am now in the process of booking again for next year! !

Reviews.Title: “nice basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: handen
Reviews.Content: good location, bit noisy we had spacy room with 4 beds and balcony restroom was large and clean breakfast included 2 rolls and 1 muffin with jam and coffee/tea i wouldn come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Def will return!”
Reviews.Author: travelfar
Reviews.Content: This place was a life saver.....was staying at the hotel Opera down the street, and couldnt stand the noise, paper thin walls and tiny tiny bathroom..every place was full and I happened upon Hotel Peninsular . Both Alex and Jose Antonio both were so sweet and concerned for me and how miserable i was they got me a room for the following 8 nights. I WAS SO HAPPY when i walked into my room, with a double bed, en-suite bathroom with huge tub and shower and faced the back....i never had any problems , room cleaned and sheets and towels immaculate, granted the breakfast is sparse in compar. to us "super sized" americans, but believe me it beats paying over $10.00 u.s.d. for a small coffee and croissant right down the street! very very close to the Baqeria Market....so convenient to bring back cheese and wine to room at night..... I CANT SAY ENUF NICE THINGS ABOUT THIS PLACE, but esp. the wonderful staff they have working for them. I hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “awful!”
Reviews.Author: helloIreland
Reviews.Content: This was the most awful hotel Ive ever stayed in! it was down a narrow alleyway and the smell was just unbearable. There were about 50 of us staying here and about 5 rooms had to be changed because of the smell in the rooms. Also we came home one night and found a mouse running around the room.....breakfast consisted of a bun and 2 rolls and that was it! i wouldnt reccommend this hotel at all!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: barunkevin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel only for an overnight stay because it was close to the airport. Overall it was a good hotel being a 1* but it felt like sleeping in a corridor cause we could hear all the people in the other rooms talking and there was alot of noise. Staff spoke English but didn't look very happy and the beds were infact two single beds while we had booked a room with a double bed. Although it was a clean hotel and very good location, right in the centre of girona I don't think I would want to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel, Poor place”
Reviews.Author: leedylan1998
Reviews.Content: Recently visited Barcelona along with 20,000 football supporters expecting huge things from the City. Due to a scramble to find tickets, i unfortunately did not get to see a lot of the city, however as the hotel was yards away from La Ramblas then at least we were supposedly in the place to be. Peninsular is down a side street which if not busy, i could see as not being a very pleasant walk. Into the hotel and reception is dated and scruffy with the lift just simply in a terrible state. Room was not very clean, paint coming off the ceiling, toilet not flushing correctly, no shower curtain, no lock on the toilet door, dated furniture, no television and only one plug point for charging phone. In the 25 hours i spent awake in Barcelona, i witnessed someone chasing 2 pick-pockets, i caught one physically in the act with someone beside me and i saw 2 girls reduced to tears as all their money and cards had been stolen. My friend also had 550 euros stolen. We were offered all sorts at the end of the hotel street from less than desirable people and it simply left a bitter taste in my mouth. I would certainly never take my family to Barcelona and if i had to give it a second go, then Peninsular will be firmly at the bottom of any list i compile of places to stay. No better than a hostel to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Marga88ca
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel! The rooms were clean, comfortable, and the fact that it’s an old convent makes it an historical stay. The courtyard is beautiful, and the staff is very friendly. Our room was great, clean bed and private bathroom. It is fairly loud if you are facing the street, because it is pedestrian, narrow, with lots of traffic. But this is true of any larger city in Spain, so noise is quite difficult to avoid regardless. This hotel is very centrally located, just of Las Ramblas, a short walk from the beach, sites, etc. From our point of view, it is about the cheapest you can go (unless you get into a youth hostal, with 6 to a room and shared bathroom) while still being centrally located. We paid about 70 euro a night in peak season, this includes a modest breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious and excellent location. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: 7Bluebells
Reviews.Content: Just off the busy La Rambla the Hotel Peninsular location is fantastic: being within a short walking distance of most of Barcelona's attractions. The hotel is basic but very clean. Most if not all of the staff are friendly, and will appreciate it if you make an effort to talk to them in Spanish. We stayed during festival week in Barcelona and the hotel was full. Bear in mind before you book that this hotel is very popular with students, so it can get a bit noisy at night. We didn't get back till late most nights so we didn't really find it a problem and the staff at the hotel asked people to keep it down if and when they did come in late. We only went to breakfast once during our 9-day stay, as we preferred to go to a cafe instead. Breakfast is nothing to get excited about and consists of 2 rolls and a cake. Don't bother looking for meals on La Rambla, they're pricey and bland, instead we went to the gothic quarter most nights. Just around the corner from the hotel (the first turning off the road the hotel is on as you walk to La Rambla) there's a good restaurant/ cocktail bar and a organic vegetarian restaurant where we went on a few occasions and wasn't disappointed. I would stay here again as its fantastic value for money and as I mentioned before the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before staying here”
Reviews.Author: ruthmarti
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was very convenient. The evening desk clerk was very nice. It was extremely noisy - there was a group of 70 teenagers staying there. We watched while the night clerk freaked out and started screaming (and wouldn't stop) at them and they weren't really doing anything wrong - there was just a lot of teenagers at one time in the lobby as they had just returned for the evening. The breakfast wasn't anything to brag about. We were due to leave in the early morning and tried to pay our bill (they only accept cash or traveler's checks) the night before. The exchange rate was posted as 70 Euros for $100. The clerk would not let us pay the bill. Early the next morning, the exchange rate was posted as 65 Euros for $100. The clerk was extremely rude when I explained that I thought we should be given the higher exchange rate since we had tried to pay the night before. I even emailed them after I got home as I thought this was not right. I did not get any response.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing was the location!”
Reviews.Author: MaidaVale81
Reviews.Content: Thought I’d had discovered a great find when I booked this hotel and encouraged by the positive comments on here at 75 euro's including breakfast thought it was a bargain. However as soon as I arrived wished I had stayed at my 1st hotel slightly further out. The reception staff were rude questioning my booking even though I had it in black and white. The room it's self felt like a prison cell, sparsely furnished and dark, not a place you would feel happy to spend anymore time in then to just sleep, and the so called breakfast consisted of a stale roll, muffin and bitter coffee. If value and location are the most important factors to you then stay here, if not you can find hotels 100 times better slightly further out at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: JakeHants_England
Reviews.Content: For the price (we paid 75 euros per night for a double with bathroom/toilet) this place is excellent. The location could not be much better if you want to be near the La Rambla which is only a couple of minutes walk away (if that). The room was always clean and well made. Though messages here suggest the staff were not friendly I found quite the opposite they were very cheery and helpful. It is not luxury but then you would not expect it to be given the price and the very central location. I have no reason to fault staff or hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not a plastic tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonCamberwell
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the peninsular several times- the family who run the hotel are really friendly, the rooms have been renovated without trashing the atmosphere since the days they were prepared to take student parties. The atmosphere is really calm, stepping out of the Ramblas into the hotel's central atrium. the hotel has great history, having been a convent, a brothel, and host to art exhibitions by artists like Rebecca Horn. The only discomfort i've ever experienced there was the noise of some drunken English middle class tourists, but a call to the desk had them silent in minutes. This hotel feels like Barcelona, not 'Anywhere' and if you are a budget traveller, who wants to be at the centre of things, this one should do very well.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been worse”
Reviews.Author: zeus16
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean, somewhat small and very simple. We did have a slight sewage smell coming from the bathroom, however it was very clean. The noise from the Atrium was a little disruptive, but we managed. The only issue we had was there was not door handle on the inside of our bathroom, and the door stuck a little so we did get trapped in there a couple of times. Thank goodness there were two of us or we might still be in there :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Javea03730
Reviews.Content: We saw the hotel featured in an article in a national newspaper and having read the reviews on this site, expected basic accommodation but with a great location which was important to us. When we arrived at the hotel there was building work underway and everything was very dusty. Our room certainly was very basic and monastic but clean. We were a little concerned at the lack of bedding as it was a cold weekend. When we requested more, we were told we could not have any until the next day. One of the great features of the hotel is its beautiful courtyard and atrium - shame it´s out of bounds to guests after 9pm. We decided to go and explore Las Ramblas - this really is a great central location although the street could be a little scary at night for women on their own. As we went to leave the room, we noticed that the window was open and when we tried to close it, we found that a large pane of glass was completely missing, giving direct access to our room from the roof! Having found what we felt was a nicer hotel just a short stroll away for only 10€ per night more, we decided not to stay at the Pensinsular.

Reviews.Title: “Great moderately priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharon65
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel by accident and it turned out to be a little gem. Fabulous location a hundred meters or so from Las Ramblas, but away from the noise. Hotel has a faded granduer feel and the central atrium was stunning. We had a room overlooking the atrium on our first stay and wouldn't recommend this any noise carries. Breakfast can only really be described as okay. Staff were helpful and knowledgable, rooms clean, front balcony room was amazingly quiet for a major city. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: Rozie
Reviews.Content: I was looking for somewhere to stay that was inexpensive but clean and central, and booked this after reading previous reviews on Trip Advisor. I stayed here for 3 nights in June with a friend and it was ideal for us (70 Euros a night for twin room). It's situated at a fairly short walk down La Ramblas from the bus stop in Plaza de Catalunya (where the airport shuttle drops you). The hotel is in a side street off La Ramblas but not too far off. It's very clean, and I think all rooms have private bathroom (ours had a shower and a bath). The price included breakfast which was pretty basic but good enough (rolls, orange juice and tea/coffee). The inside of the building itself is lovely and feels quite peaceful. The reception staff were helpful and let us store our luggage on the last day. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “My kind of place!”
Reviews.Author: beech_bunnie
Reviews.Content: This family run hotel has everything a budget traveler could ever want or need: comfortable bed, air conditioning, private bath, balcony and free breakfast! Great location in the side streets of Las Ramblas, a couple of steps to the action but far enough from the noise. Very clean and the housekeeper did not even take the tip I left for her. Front desk staff was very friendly, helpful and really concerned for the safety of their guests, which means this is not the place to bring back your one-night stands. I would definitely stay here again =)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For A Good Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Peninsular with friends when we came to stay for 4 days for an Art trip. The hotel rooms were average with a cupboard, bedside cabinet and beds. We were lucky enough to have a balcony which, we loved and spent most our nights looking out into the street. The breakfast was good with no limits to tea, coffee and juice and the spread cheese we were given was amazing and always finished. Its a great hotel for the price and the location is superb with a pub just down the road and clubs 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Take this hotel if you re looking for...”
Reviews.Author: NYlover83
Reviews.Content: ... a clean and safe place in the heart of Barcelona. We stayed 5 nights in a room with private bath. Though we travelled in a group of 3 we got a 4 bed room with a small balcony. Don't expect much!!! The rooms were small and the interior was spartanic but they were clean and the daily changed towels were, too. The Peninsular is the perfect hotel if you stay to visit Barcelona and its nightlife. I would definitly stay here again and save the bugs for the expensive nightlife. If you think about getting up early in the morning for the breakfast, forget it!! Every guest gets two bread rolls which are adamant! You can't cut them without hurting yourself (I tried believe me) and two sorts of marmelade (only this small plastic cups) sufficient for at least one bread roll. The best at breakfast is the muffin it is pretty good. The stuff was always kind and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scuba-in-Cuba
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we expected it to be, a no frills budget hotel. We were just looking for a place to sleep at night, why would you want to spend time in a hotel room when you are in one of the most beautiful cities in the world? We didn't have any problems with noisy guests, I suppose it just depends on who the other guests are at the time that you are staying. The staff were amazing, very friendly and helpful. We arrived at 6.30am and asked if we could store our bags until check-in, instead they allowed us to go straight to the room (you cannot imagine how happy we were after spending the night in the airport). On the day we left, they allowed us to store our bags there until we left for the airport at 8pm. I would definitely reccommend this hotel to anyone that is wanting to stay the night in a stunning centrally located hotel, for less than $100.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peninsular with my family for 4 nights in July 2001. The family room was basic, but very clean. Good bath-shower, wc. I found the staff to be helpfull. Inside the hotel it is really nice, however the narrow street outside looks a little grubby, but we never had any problems. I would be more concerned on "La Rambles" from bag snatchers and pick pockets. We had a small balcony looking over the narrow street, great for people watching. The location is excellent as its only a few mins walk from La Ramblas next to the opera house and not far from the excellent market. Great places to eat all around, eat off La Ramblato save a little cash if you wish. For an excellent day out use the Turistic Bus from the "Plaza De Catalonia" at the top of La Ramblas to travel about the city, about 15 euros, hop on, hop off as you wish all day long. Great trip....good value hotel, clean with nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: SantaMonice123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peninsular for 4 nights and found it very accomodating with a terrific location, close to everything. I traveled as a single and received a room with 2 twin beds for 50 Euro. I would definately recommend this hotel for the budget traveller who expects no frills. The staff was friendly, the rooms and hotel are kept clean and has a quaint feel to it. I agree that you can hear people come and go, so if you are a light sleeper earplugs would help. I had no problem though. Remember to bring a wash cloth if you use them, as they are not provided. Breakfast was standard fair, an assortment of 3 types of bread, coffee & orange juice. They do have a hair dryer you can use from the lobby, but you can find one for cheap if you don't have one with proper outlet. Definately a great bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: TreesDorset
Reviews.Content: The good point about this budget hotel is its proximity to Las Ramblas and from there to Calalunya square for the buses etc.,the waterfront, tourist information and gothic area. It is down a narrow, mostly traffic free, street off Las Ramblas, which connects to the Montjuic area so lots of people about. It is very clean, the rooms are small, very, very basic but the bathroom was fine. It did have air conditioning. Other Tripadvisors' recommendation of being out all day and just using the room to sleep in is about right but it does help to bring ear plugs, you will need them. The hotel has an atrium with small walkways all around on each of the four floors so the sound of anything carries up and around. The old doors have gaps under (it was a former convent) and on several nights it was very noisy as students use it and were coming back late at night when we were in bed. The breakfast was two fresh bread rolls, butter, jam and a little plain cake with tea/coffe and some orange squash (not fresh juice). The owners were friendly and kept things in the hotel safe for us. It is a good budget hotel for a short sightseeing break but I would not like to have it as a main holiday or for more than 5/6 days. A minus for us was that we had booked a twin room (for two girlfriends) and despite confirming this again by fax only got a small double bed which they couldnt change until the last night and then we couldnt be bothered to change. Just a word of warning: please be so careful with your bags, my friend's rucksack was tampered with on an escalator but nothing stolen at the Barcelonabus station which was full of unsavory types and the bus driver had to chase some off when we arrived. Do all the usual safety checks - there are now lots of police about all over the city (but not at this bus station at night) and everyone tells you to watch your bags. There is even a notice on the breakfast table telling you not to leave your bag - it does make even a seasoned traveller a little alarmed! Rucksacks are such an easy target especially those with easy opening zips at the front and do look so touristy.

Reviews.Title: “dont trust the staff here!”
Reviews.Author: traveller123159
Reviews.Content: Although most of the reviews of this hotel tell a fairly accurate picture- central, basic. attractive building, noisy and so on, we met an unexpected problem when we brought a group of 26 students. Despite very careful bookings through our agent Studylink on arrival (late, with tired students) we found that the hotel had put us in rooms where students were expected to share beds- claiming that this was normal practice. Basically the hotel had delibearatley overbooked and told us barefaced lies to cover up, knowing there was nothing we could do about it. We had Spanish speakers with us but could do nothing- it was a take it or leave it attitude, and the same thing happened when some of our female staff were intimidated by german students in the room next door over the following days. We got around the problem of rooms by moving beds and putting some students in another hotel, which was paid for eventually by Studylink, but it made an unpleasant start to the visit. So don't trust the staff, and be prepared for them to try it on and cause problems.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty basic, noisy, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here a few nights after scoring a cheap flight to Barcelona. Peninsular was something like our sixth or seventh choice, and it felt that way. While an old convent sounds quaint, it means basic rooms with second-hand furniture -- including a tiny double bed -- and no natural light. We didn't get much noise from the outside, but the thin walls and doors left us at the mercy of neighbors, and the couple across the hall were pretty loud, especially slamming doors in the morning. (And we didn't sleep in that much, believe me.) The only real positive beyond price -- and that's questionable -- is location. This hotel is only a few steps off Las Ramblas, and it wasn't a horrible walk to Montjuic, either. Easy access to a couple of subway stops, and while the area to the west can be shady, this generally is a safe location. Try El Pollo Rico across the street for lunch. Good price, good food. In the end, this will do in a pinch, but it's best to spend all day seeing Barcelona and come back exhausted do you won't mind the room so much.

Reviews.Title: “Really OK!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona to celebrate New Year 2005! Even in this season it's very nice to visit this city! At first we were a bit anxious because I read some less pleasant reviews, but none of them are true! You can expect all the comfort you need. The beds are fine and the bathroom has a good shower. It's basic but much better than some other **- hotels I've seen. Breakfast in the morning is more than enough and you'll only be hungry at lunchtime ... to have some tapas! Enjoy your stay at Peninsular!

Reviews.Title: “Dont be put off by the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Barcababe
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at the Hotel Peninsular through STA travel, then looked on the web to see if I could find out anything more about the hotel. I was really upset when I found this site and read the reports about bedbugs!! I wished I'd checked it out before I booked! But it was too late to change it so I went along anyway, and ended up being pleasantly surprised. There was no sign of any bedbugs (we checked matresses and sheets, and we have no bites a week on). Both the room and shared washroom facilities were clean. The staff were friendly, and breakfast was perfectly adequate (bread, a muffin and tea/coffee/oj). The air conditioning worked a treat so we had a lovely cool nights sleep, and noise was never a problem, though we did invest in some earplugs after reading advice on this site. I think this is something worth doing no matter where you plan to stay, as the movements of the other guests are pretty much beyond a hotel's control! There was not much natural light in our room as the window faced into the building, but this also meant that there was no external noise from the street - a big plus in noisey Barcelona! The furniture was worn out (e.g. drawers wouldn't open fully, bedside table was on a slant etc.), but the beds were comfy. The large plant-draped foyer area is lovely to come back to. The hotel definately has character and we felt comfortble and totally at home there. The atmosphere is relaxed, and this makes it an oasis amongst the bustling busy streets. I would say don't be put off by the bad reviews on this site, but also don't expect a palace. The Hotel Peninsular is a fine place to stay, at an excellent price. If you want a base to enjoy the city of Barcelona from, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel: mold, noise, cockroaches & no hot water after 8am”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is cheap and, yes, it has an interesting courtyard, but I cannot recommend staying there.It has the feel of a prison - or maybe that's just the fact that it used to be a convent: very basic rooms, my one had no windows, high and narrow doors and constant noise.My room had black mold on the bathroom ceiling and smelt awful. The mold formed black chains which hung down from the ceiling. I felt soiled and dirty just being in the room.On top of this, the noise is constant. The walls are paper-thin and you can hear everything, and I mean everything, that is going on, not just in adjacent rooms but in the hotel as a whole. Forget sleep - you're not going to get any.Luckily I never experienced bedbugs but certainly cockroaches scurrying around in the bathroom.After about 8 am, forget hot water. The strange thing is it didn't just turn cold - nothing came out of the tap at all.All together, I felt sullied staying in this hotel. It was one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. Horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Charactor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came to Barcelona in April 2004 for a long Weekend , we had not booked any accommadation prior . We stumbled across the Hotel Peninsular and stayed three nights . The Hotel which was a convent was steeped in charactor and was unlike anywhere we had ever stayed . The accommmadation is basic but there are clean towells & bedding provided & rooms are clean .We found all staff very helpful & Friendly , Breakfast is basic & enough. The location is perfect , the price per night is very good , we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Interesting, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in the summer of last year and I would like to put the record straight. This is a very clean hotel, an extremely interesting building, excellent location and very helpful and friendly English speaking staff. The rooms were spotlessly clean, the floors were clean, the towels were changed every day even though I was doing my bit for the environment by reusing them. The beds were comfortable and sheets were clean. Rooms had air conditioning that worked, was quiet at night, even though near the action. I admit that the rooms needed a little work on them but in a funny way it made the rooms charming. What made this hotel stand out from the rest was the charming atrium. As they say you get what you pay for! And for what you pay for at Peninsular you get and a bit more the history and friendliness too. Breakfast is good, typical continental style!! Breakfast is not supposed to be a feast after all! I would totally recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: yagkos
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel. Stayed one night there and I found it sufficient for that. I would look for something better if I were to stay longer. I had a shared facilities room which looked a bit drab. It is certainly noisy since the hotel layout makes every slamming door sound right next to ur bed. Since however accommodation in Barcelona is so insanely expensive I think it is an acceptable compromise.Bed sheets toilets and shower were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful on the surface....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After seeing a photograph in a travel book, I stayed three nights at the Peninsular Hotel. I regret that I didn´t find these reviews until I went searching the internet for another place to stay. The front desk staff was very friendly, and the Hotel has great charachter, but it would be better to ask to see the courtyard and check into the hotel across the street. Unsucessfully, I tried two different rooms at the Peninsular, hoping to find a little peace and quiet. The cackle of the freindly happy maids echoed off the tile courtyard by day, and the thunderous door slamming by the "We´re so tipsy that we don´t realize anyone else might be sleeping at 4:00 a.m." crowd kept me-a noise seasoned New Yorker, from getting any sleep. I would have tried to call the front desk...but the disconnected telephones seem to only be in the rooms for decoration. I put up with the hole in the corner called "the shower", and with the "here´s what you get" continental breakfast, but what finally did me in was the thunderous pounding of the water pipes in the morning that literally shook my room. (I was told at check out that this was only a problem on the top (4th) floor. Once I checked into the beautiful Hotel Espana (same price across the street), and got some sleep- I was able to laugh at the whole Peninsular experience.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did save on money, by staying at the Peninsular. That was our main goal, to stay in a clean no-frills places to be able to do more with our travel money. So, we did accomplish that. The staff is friendly, and speak English. The location was ok, right off of the Ramblas, but the street seemed a little shady at night. We stayed in an attic room, which was roomy, there were three of us, and the room really had the capacity for four. The shower was a bit of an inconvenience, water got all over the floor no matter how careful you were, and the room always seemed damp because of this. We may stay at a more luxurious place next time, but it wasn't bad for the money, clean, good location, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel at the end of Novenber 2003 and were generally happy with the accomodation. The fifth floor comprises of six "Attic Rooms". These have all been recently refurbished. It's true the rooms are spartan but ours was clean, the bed comfortable and the en suite facilities were bang up to date. The only problem was it took a few minutes for the hot water to arrive!. If your Spanish isn't up to scratch, no problem; the friendly staff speak excellent English. It is ideally located for La Rambla, only 150yds away. It isn't worth turning right at night leaving the hotel. I was reminded of the Thriller video!. The attic rooms comprise four doubles, one for three persons and one for four. If possible try to book one of these. Some of the other rooms looked a bit austere. NB Payment is by cash or travellers cheques only. At 70 euros per room not a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “Our Place in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this very well-placed, inexpensive small hotel several times over the past three years and regard it as 'our place' in Barcelona. The first time we came as visitors now we return, whenever we get the chance, as friends. The warm, friendly atmosphere is very welcoming, the rooms clean & comfortable and the staff very helpful. We have recommended the Peninsular to several friends who have also been delighted with its quiet serenity - unexpected in such a popular area just minutes off La Rambla!

Reviews.Title: “Covered in Bites, Itching to death”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is quaint, the people friendly. The rooms are basic, showers have no curtains.All of the above is nothing next to the fact that I am covered in bed-bug bites and itching like crazy.Breakfast, a stale bread roll and small muffin.We stayed for 3 nights and thought it was decent until the bites appeared on the last day and have yet to vanish.Not a bad Hotel but they need to sort out the hygiene.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, lovely interior, no sleep.”
Reviews.Author: stulp
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful hotel. The Jugendstil courtyard is charming, and really one of a kind. I would even say it's worth a visit if you are staying in a nearby hotel. The staff was also very helpful and cheerful. BUT, all hotelrooms on all four floors have doors into the courtyard (elevator too). The closing doors sound like gunshots, which echo off the courtyard tiles and through the whole building right into the paper-walled rooms. With juniors getting home at 4:00, and seniors getting up at 8:00, this leaves little room for sleep... If you are deaf, or an insomniac, this hotel is perfect; otherwise try something else.

Reviews.Title: “Peninsular Hotel is Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read the Tripadvisor reviews before we travelled, and booked our October 2003 visit on the strength of the generally favourable comments about Hotel Peninsular. The hotel was excellent value for money. It is spartan and the decor of our (two) rooms has not been refurbished recently. Breakfast was a roll with butter and jam(and a little sponge cup cake), washed down with hot (or warm) liquids. But on all other value counts, it was excellent. The reception staff were characters; helpful, attentive, funny, memorable. The location is excellent, just 2 minutes from Las Ramblas. We will happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a "wow factor" verandar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were recommented this hotel as somewhere, clean, tidy, not posh and central with friendly helpful staff - and it was just that. It is a block off the center of Las Rambles. A block away from the metro. Is quiet and central what more could you want. Oh and as for the central verandar, it just has to be seen, with the hanging plants and the balconied corridors, its wonderful. Its a great place to stay if you don't do 5*.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Peninsular
